reference.title: Don't skimp on wall prepping.
reference.shortdesc: Repairing and priming walls and surfaces before painting is an important step that should not be missed. Painting a wall, in fact, should be referred to more as Wall prep and less as painting. Prepping in the foundation and painting is the icing on the cake.

section.title: Skim Coat the walls.
section.p: The first part is examing and repairing the wall board or plaster:

ol.li: Fill in any holes with premixed joint compound. There will be several passes of joint compound so do not worry too much on this first pass.
After the walls are patches sand the joint compound until smooth. Repeat this step if necessary.
Repeat and sand with a wet spounge.

section.title: Prime walls with the appropriate primer
section.p: After fixing the walls it is import to apply 1 coat of the approriate primer.
Select a primer that will block and stick to the old paint and is appropriate for to be applied paint.

section.title: The temperature of the paint, the termperature of the ambiant air and the overnight temperature should be taken into consideration.
section.p: Wait a day if need to apply the first coat of paint. The primer will be dry and ready for you.
